books.title: The Lives of the Caesars
books.author: Suetonius
books.summary: The lives of the twelve emperors called Caesar are described in detail by a near-contemporary Roman historian.

books.title: Doctor Syn
books.author: Russell Thorndike
books.summary: A king’s enforcer searching for smugglers uncovers the dark past of the inhabitants of a small English town.

books.title: Memoirs of a Revolutionist
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: A Russian revolutionary tells of his life from early childhood, his adventures as a geographer, and how he turned into an anarcho-communist.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Emily of New Moon
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A budding poetess and orphan goes to live with her estranged aunts.

books.title: Sunshine Sketches of a Little Town
books.author: Stephen Leacock
books.summary: A humorous account of life in the fictional small town of Mariposa.

books.title: Troilus and Cressida
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Trojan prince falls in love with a woman amid the Trojan War, only to see her exchanged to the Greeks for a prisoner of war.

books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: The Duel
books.author: Aleksandr Kuprin
books.summary: A Russian officer battles disillusionment and unrequited love.

books.title: John Silence Stories
books.author: Algernon Blackwood
books.summary: A physician turned detective uses his psychic abilities to solve the strange cases presented to him.

books.title: The Bolshevik Myth
books.author: Alexander Berkman
books.summary: A left-wing radical records his experiences in revolutionary Russia.

books.title: Murder in the Gunroom
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A private detective is called upon to evaluate a gun collection that contains a dark secret.

books.title: Two Treatises of Government
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: Locke critiques the concepts of absolute monarchy and divine right, arguing instead for a government founded on natural rights, individual freedom, and the consent of the governed, which protects the fundamental rights of life, liberty, and property.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Uller Uprising
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: 450 years in the future, a shrewd general must quell an alien rebellion on a remote colonized planet.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
